issue.title: Peacock ads not blocked anymore.

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS

### AdGuard version

0.107.55

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://channelstore.roku.com/details/2dd1a2670117700b87d7a40bfa7e6138/peacock-tv

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

NoCoin Filter List

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>When using the Peacock app on our Roku it is no longer blocking ads. I don't have a screenshot or picture of it. But this behavior is across the board on all of my devices. I also have an Nvidia Shield and the Peacock app on my android phone. They all were blocking ads, and yesterday we noticed they are no longer blocking ads. 
2. I have updated all of my filters and the adguard version. This is currently running on a Raspberry Pi. No changes have been made to my network or devices. So not sure what would have caused the ads all of a sudden. 

3. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: ok so i did reproduce a block and it seems like it does block ads all i had to do was fastfoward 10 seconds as blocking the ad did somewhat break it i guess u would call it

comment.body:
i downloaded peacock on my roku and saw two ad domains that weren't in your screenshots.

do you see these in your logs?

mt.ssai.peacocktv.com
mediatailor.us-east-2.amazonaws.com

Looks like they pertain to amazon ads. but if you dont see them in your log blocking them wont help your case

issue.title: payment.patient.athenahealth.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://payment.patient.athenahealth.com/notification/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpayment.patient.athenahealth.com%2Fnotification%2F) ### Comment > Page displays custom error message when directed from a link in SMS and email. Whitelisting works on MacOS but not iOS. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/greg8nz3idk48gk44o40kk8wggk4k88a45gw92be3c.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ainjqisap8w8oooww0w8w40wo0woo8oc6ao90s5jlk.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.8 System version: | iOS 18.2.1 License type: | paid DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection Other extensions used: | Wipr 2, NordVPN
